page.title: 16The Wendover Bypass 1988/9
page.content: A bypass for Wendover, first proposed in 1937, has recently been approved. An exhibition to explain the proposals was held in Wendover in April 1985 and after public consultation, the "Blue Route" has been chosen. This plan avoids the need for re-routing the railway line and building a new station. The projected cost to date is 5.4 million pounds. It is estimated that 22.1 acres of agricultural land will be claimed and the 3.8 kms. route will require 5 new bridges. Inspite of popular approval of the scheme, the trade and accessibility of several local businesses will be adversely affected.
